Sentence: Good place to learn about health care, tourism, technology, mental care, dental care and many more .

They also have two indoor hall for the functions.

They teach us in very good way and also give us great source for topics to clearing out the problems that are most likely to arise from stress.

I completed my program last September 2022 and had a great experience with this college, i took Culinary Management program from Punjab, India and came here as a student, i really enjoyed my cooking classes and got some skills, all chefs were very good and cool as always.
I made some friends from another countries and came to know about their culture and cuisinesüòÉ.
But sad for meüòï As i came in pandemic(Jan 2021) and i didn‚Äôt enjoyed any college perks because all things were closed at my time, now college seems full of students.
Never had a problem with the education aspect, the professors were professional and supportive....
However, I am incredibly disappointed with the registration process and the system they use.
The site they use called banner barely functions and is unreliable.
This is the platform for registration, fees, etc.
When it doesn't work, good luck getting someone at the college to help you.
Most likely they will refer you to someone else, who will refer you to someone else, and ultimately hope you figure it out on your own rather than provide any customer service.
Perhaps it's like this at other colleges, but you'd expect some level of customer service for the amount of tuition + other "necessary" fees.
If you intend to sign up for Computer Programming at this college, simply DON'T.
You are wasting your time and money and will not learn the latest tech to get you a job in the field.
The program is old, very few instructors are enthusiast about what they do.
Through out this course, I only found 2-3 good instructors.
Most of them are not up to date and are probably out of the industry.
They hire people who have no idea about what they are teaching.
For example, the Math instructor will read the slide in class together with you.
Yeah, she didn't come to class prepared, she only read whatever provided once she's in class.
Or the Javascript instructor doesn't know Javascript.
The test was brought from a different college's Java class.
Terrible choice of teachers from the college.
The least support I received from the program ever.
Need to ask a question about progress?
The student advisor doesn't answer your email.
Need to ask about a program specific permission, laid out on the college's website and policy?
The program coordinator doesn't know about it and deny to help.
Worst student service ever.
I went to a different college in Toronto before and they were much better.
The program coordinator actually get involve with our progress and they made sure we are prepared and equipped with whatever the industry needed.
My last semester consists of 6 courses, only two are coding related, one project management, two General Education (GNED) and one Linux course.
If this doesn't speak to you about the quality of this program, I don't know what will do. DO NOT attend Georgian College for this program.
I had a terrible experience with Georgian College.

I applied for a postgraduate program for my brother but unfortunately his visa was refused after only 11 days of applying but IRCC never notified my brother plus my brother took ill for months that prevented him from checking his IRCC page nor even suspecting he had received an unfavorable response to his visa application.
It was only when the term began and he was becoming worried that he checked his profile and found a refusal letter lying in his inbox.
Unfortunately this was almost 4 months after the dated visa refusal letter.
He sent this letter to the college asking to refund the fees deposit I had made on his behalf with explanations on the reason for the delay.
Georgian College vehemently refused to refund my fees deposit claiming that they did not receive the refusal letter within 10days.
All our explanations and plea on compassionate grounds have fell on deaf ears.
This college held on to my deposit and still cancelled my brother's admission.
This college has no integrity nor compassion for the plight of students from the international 2nd and 3rd nation countries who put in so much to seek further education.
Any international student going to this college, does so at their own risk.
The school and its management are out to defraud and find every opportunity to withhold student's deposit.
I have not given up on seeking my refund.
I will keep finding viable means to channel my complaints and seek justice.
